column1: #FORMAT=WebAnno TSV 3.2

#T_RL=webanno.custom.Coref|type|BT_webanno.custom.Referent
#Text=Fira
#Text=Fira
#Text=( also called
#Text=Thera
#Text=or Thira ) is the main town of Santorini island .
#Text=Though it has little except the museum , the cable car and the few bars and clubs , it is a good base to use as there are buses from many other parts of the island .
#Text=Understand
#Text=Every day during the summer is a bustling metropolis as cruise ships from all over the Mediterranean and Aegean seas descend .
#Text=As a result prices in Thira ( and Santorini generally ) tend to be a little higher than other Greek Islands .
#Text=Get around
#Text=The main bus station of Santorini is in Fira ( ) , where you can catch a bus going almost anywhere on the island , usually half hourly .
#Text=Online timetable
#Text=.
#Text=Up the stairs behind the bus station and across a parking lot to the west is .
#Text=A public restroom is located at the southern end of the taxi stand .

#Text=There is a crazed woman who confiscates the toilet paper from the toilets in the mornings , and then accosts patrons as they enter , demanding 50 euro cents for a couple of sheets of toilet paper .
#Text=She follows people into the restroom and continues to harass them while they use the facilities .
#Text=Bring your own napkins , and try to ignore her .
#Text=Another great way to get around the ( small ) island is by hiring a quad bike ( usually named " ATV " ) from numerous locations in the main tourist villages .
#Text=For € 20 a day , it is better value than taxis and more fun than a bus .
#Text=See
#Text=Museum of Prehistoric Thira
#Text=Definitely pay a visit to this museum , where the story of Akrotiri and other ancient settlements is vividly told through a stunning collection of Neolithic and Bronze Age artifacts .
#Text=Full € 3 , reduced € 2 .
#Text=Special ticketing package for Ancient Thera , Akrotiri , Archaeological Museum , Museum of Prehistoric Thera , Collection of Icons and Ecclesiastical Artefacts at Pyrgos : € 14 , reduced € 7 .
#Text=In , 2 km south of Fira , you can find traditional Santorini architecture .
#Text=Archaeological Museum of Thera
#Text=.
#Text=It houses artefacts from Proto-Cycladic culture of the 3rd millennium BC , and continues on to the Classical period .
#Text=Full € 2 , reduced € 1 .
#Text=Imerovigli village
#Text=Imerovigli has many lovely churches , all made in the Cycladic architectural style .
#Text=They most notable are the church of Ai-Stratis , in the centre of the village , and the Monastery of Saint Nikolaos , on the way connecting Imerovigli to Fira .
#Text=Skaros Rock
#Text=.
#Text=The remains of a Venetian Castle built in 1207 by Marco Sanudo , the ruler of all Cyclades islands that time .
#Text=Do
#Text=There 's actually not a lot to do in Fira .
#Text=Apart from the few museums and craft studios ( which are open fairly late ) , travelers seeking unique experiences unobtainable elsewhere will be disappointed .
#Text=Stroll through the shopping district ( for overpriced jewelry , designer clothing and handbags ) and go to the numerous ( American-styled ) discos and bars .
#Text=Watch a sunset over dinner .
#Text=Walk along Agiou Mina street .
#Text=This street goes through Fira part-way down the cliff , from the south part of town all the way to the cable car .
#Text=It provides the stunning views of Fira that you came to see .
#Text=You can walk either north or soth , but walking north has the advantage that the main part of Fira is in front of you .
#Text=To get there , from the main cathedral , walk with the sea to your right , just left of Hotel Atlantis , about 50 m. Walk around 1500 BC restaurant , and you 'll be on the path .
#Text=Just be careful of the donkey poop !
#Text=Go to the Old port .
#Text=Whoever said " Getting there is half the fun " was likely referring to the Old Port .
#Text=Or , in this case , getting there is 99 % of the fun .
#Text=There is almost nothing to do at the Old Port ( except perhaps take a couple of pictures from sea level ) .
#Text=But the ride down and up can be fun .
#Text=Your choices are the cable car ( € 4 one way ) , donkey ride ( € 5 per person , plus a € 5 " tip " for your " guide " ) .
#Text=Try to avoid walking this road at any cost , it 's quite long and it 's completely covered with slippery donkey poop .
#Text=The smell makes you want to vomit .
#Text=If you want to avoid the smell and the scene just take the cable car but aware of possible congestion when people from the ferries arrive and leave .
#Text=Some local mule guides may also try to cheat you by demanding a payment for walking down , they will try to sell you a small piece of paper that says ticket without any numbers on it .
#Text=Ignore these people , the road is free .
#Text=Get out of the tourist section .
#Text=The tourist part of Fira is surprisingly small ; a couple minutes walk away from the sea brings you out of the tourist area .
#Text=While the architecture here is not stunning , it certainly is different than you will see elsewhere .
#Text=Plus , you 'll have a chance to marvel at the fact that even though Fira land prices are very high , there are still empty lots in the middle of the city .
#Text=Eat
#Text=In the early evening the passengers of the cruise ships return to their vessels and cafes become much more relaxed .
#Text=Akropolis
#Text=, odos 25 martiou ( on the main road to the town of Oia ) .
#Text=The price of the dishes is lower than elsewhere in town , and that for outstanding food !
#Text=The lady in charge is a superb cook and very friendly .
#Text=Yet tourists did n't find the way to this lovely place , the locals know about the quality of this great restaurant .
#Text=Koukoumavlos Restaurant
#Text=Restaurant Koukoumavlos , by chef Nikos Pouliasis , serves modern Greek and Mediterranean cuisine .
#Text=Taste some of his favorite creations : Santorinian fava with smoked trout , salmon tartar in mandarin sauce and roasted almonds .
#Text=Lobster and monkfish terrine with anchovy caviar sour cream in forest fruit tea sauce .
#Text=Grilled beef fillet with potato puree flavored with bergamot , summer truffle sauce and parmesan ice cream .
#Text=Tiramisu with smoked eggplant mousse on a base of almonds in green bitter orange sauce .
#Text=Nikolas
#Text=, Erythrou Stavrou ( Head straight up the pedestrian mall ( Danezi ) and take the first right ) , ☏ +302286024869 .
#Text=A local eatery preserving traditional Hellenic cuisine .
#Text=No English menu is provided , but the staff is efficient in explaining the Greek menu board and provide suggestions if necessary .
#Text=Service is a departure from the overly warm receptions with most tourist traps as it is quick , efficient , and sufficiently friendly .
#Text=Must tries include the Horiatiki ( Greek ) salad , moussaka , beef stew .
#Text=Ask for " horta " , a plate of simple boiled greenery ordered by the locals and not on the menu as it is both time-consuming and difficult to prepare on a mass-scale .

#Text=Though the dish may not look overly appetizing when it arrives at the table , sprinkle on some fresh lemon juice from the provided wedge and add some salt to bring the traditional veggie dish alive .
#Text=Appetizer : 4 Euro , Mains 8-14 Euros .
#Text=Ouzeri
#Text=( Located in the center of Fira at the Fabrika shopping center which is next to the Cathedral ) , ☏ +302286021566 .
#Text=George and Iordana , the owners , welcome warmly all their guests .
#Text=You will find a great variety of traditional Greek dishes using the local products of Santorini , Greek salad , green salad with Chorotyri , Mousaka , Ouzo meatballs , Soutzoukakia .
#Text=Santo Mythos
#Text=( Located two blocks from Theotokopoulou square on M. Danezi street ) , ☏ +302286024346 .
#Text=Offers a wide range of cheap , tasty food including salads , sandwiches , moussaka , a variety of gyros , pizza , spaghetti , omelets , and both savory and dessert crepes .
#Text=Great for travelers on a budget and the service is relatively prompt by comparison to many of the other restaurants in Fira .
#Text=Gyros are € 1.70 , Greek Salads are € 4.50 .
#Text=They also deliver from 10:00 - 24:00 .
#Text=Sphinx Restaurant
#Text=( Center of Fira in front of the Cathedral ) .
#Text=Restaurant Sphinx has been accommodated in a restored mansion in Fira since 1991 .
#Text=Its unique view over the Caldera of Santorini becomes more breathtaking during the exquisite sunsets just in front of you .
#Text=Chef and owner George Psychas creates Mediterranean cuisine which showcases the fresh local produce and Aegean Sea fish .
#Text=Relaxing environment , extensive wine selection .
